name: OilTankSafetyFeatures
title: Oil Tank Safety Features
description: Oil Tank Safety Features codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A device installed on an oil tank to prevent unauthorized or accidental siphoning of fuel by blocking reverse flow through the fill line.
A concrete containment structure built around an oil tank to prevent spills from spreading beyond a controlled area.
A vertical section of pipe installed at the base of a fuel line to collect condensation and sediment, preventing contamination from entering the burner.
An electronic monitoring system that detects and alerts when liquid leaks from an oil tank or its associated piping.
A monitoring system that alerts when the oil level in a tank reaches a predetermined high or low threshold.
A containment tray or pan placed beneath tank connections, valves, or fill points to capture minor spills and drips.

designation.value: Barrière de libération (plateau de trop-plein, bac récepteur)

concept.definition: A device installed on the vent pipe that produces an audible whistle sound when the tank is being filled, indicating proper venting and alerting when the tank is nearly full.
A tank design featuring an inner tank surrounded by an outer tank or containment shell to capture leaks from the primary tank.
A valve that automatically shuts off fuel flow when the tank reaches maximum capacity to prevent overfilling and spills.
A filtration device installed in the fuel line to remove sediment, water, and contaminants before fuel reaches the burner.
A device that removes water from fuel oil before it enters the heating system, preventing corrosion and combustion problems.
